TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed ServiceType extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Represents the type of the service.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The service type indicates how the service is used by the system. The <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceController> that passes commands to the service stores a value for the service type.
The value of a ServiceType instance represents a set of flags combined using the bitwise OR operator.
The creation of interactive services is not supported. To workaround this, you can create a non-interactive service and a separate control GUI application that communicates with the service using sockets or remoting.
## Examples The following example uses the <xref:System.ServiceProcess.ServiceController> class to display the device driver services on the local computer.
[!code-cs[ServiceController#5](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.serviceprocess._8_1.cs)] [!code-cpp[ServiceController#5](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.serviceprocess._8_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[ServiceController#5](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.serviceprocess._8_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.ServiceType Adapter = int32(4)

Docs.summary: A service for a hardware device that requires its own driver.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.ServiceType FileSystemDriver = int32(2)

Docs.summary: A file system driver, which is also a Kernel device driver.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.ServiceType InteractiveProcess = int32(256)

Docs.summary: A service that can communicate with the desktop.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.ServiceType KernelDriver = int32(1)

Docs.summary: A Kernel device driver such as a hard disk or other low-level hardware device driver.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.ServiceType RecognizerDriver = int32(8)

Docs.summary: A file system driver used during startup to determine the file systems present on the system.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.ServiceType Win32OwnProcess = int32(16)

Docs.summary: A Win32 program that can be started by the Service Controller and that obeys the service control protocol. This type of Win32 service runs in a process by itself.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.ServiceProcess.ServiceType Win32ShareProcess = int32(32)

Docs.summary: A Win32 service that can share a process with other Win32 services.
